alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal San Patricio; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 2:37AM CST until January 15 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. * WHERE...Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces, Inland San Patricio, Coastal Kleberg, Coastal Nueces and Coastal San Patricio. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM to 11 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal San Patricio; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells
